header.h2: Update from Dr. Cosby on School Closures 4/21/20

div.p: Student assignments can be found in Parent Resources block below.

color: #fff; background: rgba(0,0,0,.5); display: block; position: absolute; z-index: 99; padding: 1em; box-sizing: border-box;top: auto; bottom: 0; left: 0; width: 1800px; height: auto

div.strong: Dear Mt. Healthy Parents and Students,

div.br: As you may have already heard today, April 20, 2020, Governor Mike DeWine ordered that all of Ohio’s public, community, and private K-12 school buildings remain closed to students for the remainder of the 2019-2020 academic school year due to the COVID-19 health crisis. All Mt. Healthy City School District buildings will be closed through the end of May, 2020.

While the governor’s order to close school for the rest of the school year may present challenges to some of our families, please know that Mt. Healthy City School District administrators and teachers are working diligently to partner with you in continuing your child’s education and well-being.

div.div:
Please visit News and Announcements on the main website page for more information: https://www.mthcs.org/apps/news/
We Are Mt. Healthy!
Dr. Reva C. Cosby,
Superintendent of Mt. Healthy City Schools

h3.a: Update from Dr. Cosby on School Closures 4/21/20

div.div: Have you been looking for a way to help a family in need or Mt. Healthy students? Well, Mt. Healthy Cisty School District is partnering with WLWT-TV News 5 for a Day of Giving. Bring non-perishables, cleaning products, paper products to Mt. Healthy Jr/Sr High School (in the back parking lot - warehouse)on Thursday, April 23 10 am-4pm. We will have a drive-thru drop-off set up.
Turn on your porch lights, house lights, car lights at 8:20 on Wednesday, April 23! https://forms.gle/kV1nLN3vfeywLFET6
